SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc19
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Controller

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Controller.MainController
public class MainController extends Object
It the main controller of the server. It is responsible for managing games (creation, deletion after finish, adding / removing players) and players' state (State. It is built using Singleton pattern.

  • Method Details

    • getMainController

      public static MainController getMainController()
      This method is used for implementing Singleton pattern in MainController
      Returns:
      MainController static instance

    • createClient

      public boolean createClient(ClientHandler player)
      This method creates a client. First it checks if player's name is already in use. If so, it returns false; otherwise it creates a new client and puts it in the lobby. A player is in lobby if its State is State.ACTIVE and it has no associated game.
      Parameters:
      player - is the ClientHandler corresponding to player
      Returns:
      true if and only if the player has been correctly created

    • fireGameAndPlayer

      public void fireGameAndPlayer(String gameName)
      This method is used to delete a game from gamesInfo when it finishes. Consequently, it also kicks the game players inside the lobby, sending them a DisconnectFromGameMessage. Responsible thread sleeps for Settings.TIME_TO_WAIT_BEFORE_IN_GAME_CLIENT_DISCONNECTION before doing all above operations.
      Parameters:
      gameName - is the name of the game to delete

    • setPlayerInactive

      public void setPlayerInactive(String nickname)
      This method handles player State. We can have four different situation:
      • (State.INACTIVE, null): in lobby and inactive
      • (State.ACTIVE, null): in lobby and active
      • (State.INACTIVE, not null): in game and inactive
      • (State.ACTIVE, not null): in game and active
      When a lobby player is signaled to be inactive his state is set to State.INACTIVE and it's not deleted from playersInfo. When a game player is signaled to be inactive his state becomes State.INACTIVE and this method calls GameController.removeClient(String) to remove player's observer.
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player became inactive

    • disconnectPlayerFromGame

      public void disconnectPlayerFromGame(ClientHandler player)
      This method is used when a player ask explicitly to leave game he is in, without being kicked off from the lobby (e.g. keeping his unique nickname).
      Parameters:
      player - ClientHandler of the player who want to exit game

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(ClientHandler player)
      This method is used when a player ask explicitly to be disconnected both from game or lobby. Namely, it removes player's name form playerInfo and calls removePlayerFromGame(ClientHandler, String) to disconnect player from its game.
      Parameters:
      player - player's o be disconnected ClientHandler

    • removePlayerFromGame

      public void removePlayerFromGame(ClientHandler player, String gameName)
      This method removes a player from its associated game. It signals to GameController to remove player from the game. If game is in GameState.SETUP and no clients are connected to it, it is removed from gamesInfo
      Parameters:
      player - the ClientHandler of the player to be removed
      gameName - the name of the game from which disconnect player

    • createGame

      public boolean createGame(String gameName, int numPlayer, ClientHandler player, long randomSeed)
      This method creates a new game. First, it calls checkPlayer(ClientHandler) to test if player can create a new game (not registered to other games). Then, it checks if is already in use: if yes, then send to player GameHandlingErrorMessage with ErrorType.CANNOT_BUILD_GAME. If all is ok, it builds a new game along with its game controller, sends a CreatedGameMessage to player and registers him to the game.
      Parameters:
      gameName - game name chosen by the client
      numPlayer - number of player chosen by the client
      player - ClientHandler of the player building the game
      randomSeed - random seed of the game
      Returns:
      true if game has been correctly created

    • createGame

      public boolean createGame(String gameName, int numPlayer, ClientHandler player)
      This method acts the same as createGame(java.lang.String, int, it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Networking.Server.ClientHandler, long) but random seed is not specified by the player.
      Parameters:
      gameName - game name chosen by the player
      numPlayer - number of players chosen by the game builder player
      player - ClientHandler of the game builder player
      Returns:
      true if the game has been correctly created

    • checkPlayer

      private boolean checkPlayer(ClientHandler player)
      This method checks if a player can be registered to some games. Player must not have the same name of other registered players and must not be in other active games. It must be, also, active.
      Parameters:
      player - ClientHandler of the player to check
      Returns:
      true if a player can be registered to a game

    • registerToFirstAvailableGame

      public boolean registerToFirstAvailableGame(ClientHandler player)
      This method registers a player to an available game: the first of the ArrayList<String> returned by findAvailableGames() It send to player GameHandlingErrorMessage with error type NO_GAMES_FREE_TO_JOIN if no game is available.
      Parameters:
      player - is the ClientHandler of the player to be registered
      Returns:
      name of joined game if it exists, otherwise null.

    • registerToGame

      public boolean registerToGame(ClientHandler player, String gameName)
      This method register a player to the game named gameName. It checks if the player has enough right to be registered to a game with checkPlayer(ClientHandler). Then it checks if the specified game exists, and it is accessible (in SETUP and with Game.getNumJoinedPlayer() not equal to Game.getNumPlayers()). If yes, it sets entry (State.ACTIVE, gameName) in playerInfo and calls GameController.addClient(String, ClientHandler) to register the new player.
      Parameters:
      player - ClientHandler of the player to be added
      gameName - name of the game to be registered to
      Returns:
      true if has been correctly registered to specified game

    • findAvailableGames

      public ArrayList<String> findAvailableGames()
      This method finds all available games. Nothing can be guaranteed about the other of available games name in the array list returned. For example, if game A has been available for more than B, first element of the array list can be B.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<Strings> containing all available games names.

    • reconnect

      public boolean reconnect(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      This method is responsible for advanced functionality resilience to disconnection. It is used when a player wants to reconnect to a game. First, it checks if player is registered in playerInfo and then if it is part of some game. If the answer is no, then it sends AvailableGamesMessage, otherwise signals to game controller associated to the game that a player has reconnected and updates playerInfo putting (State.ACTIVE, gameName)
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - player's to be reconnected ClientHandler
      Returns:
      true if player can be reconnected

    • isPlayerActive

      public boolean isPlayerActive(String nick)
      This method checks if player with nick is active.
      Parameters:
      nick - is the nickname of the player to search for
      Returns:
      true if and only if is in playerInfo and state of player is State.ACTIVE

    • resetMainController

      public void resetMainController()
      This static method resets an instance of MainController
